title: Hypocrisy Much? Mumbai Police Tweeted Concern For Amazon Fires, But Is Silent On Axing Of Aarey
text:
A couple of days ago, environmentalists and citizens trying to save the trees in Aarey colony in Mumbai faced a setback as the Bombay High Court ruled that the area is not a forest, and cleared the way for felling some 2,600 trees there, for the construction of a car shed as part of the Metro Rail project.

Within hours of this judgement Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation sneaked into Aarey in the dead of the night and axed hundreds of trees, even while citizens and activists stood by helplessly and watched. 29 protesters have been kept in judicial custody and section 144 has been imposed in the area.

People cannot help but notice that Mumbai Police’s Twitter handle tweeted a lament post when there were fires in the Amazon rainforest but the same handle was consciously silent when trees were being purposefully cut down in Aarey Colony.

Loss of the Amazon Rainforest is a loss to the entire Mankind. let us all resolve to protect & conserve our flora & fauna before it's too late.

If not us, then who?

If not now, then when?#SaveAmazon#SaveMotherEarth pic.twitter.com/gpc7xD70Di — Mumbai Police (@MumbaiPolice) August 28, 2019

‘If not us, then who? If not now, then when?’ a part of the tweet reads. That is correct Mumbai police, if not now, then when?

Don't Miss 1.7 K SHARES 19.9 K SHARES 701 SHARES 1.6 K SHARES

People are annoyed at the hypocrisy of the police, who have not only failed to voice its concern for the razing of Aarey forest, but is assisting MMRC in bringing down hundreds of trees.

One Twitter user wrote, 'If you mean even an ounce of what you say this would not have been happening to people who stood for #SaveAarey, The #India that these leaders dreamed of is just not this. #StopThisMadness of siding people who are out to finish the city through their greedy plans'.

The #India that these leaders dreamed of is just not this. #StopThisMadness of siding people who are out to finish the city through their greedy plans (1/2) pic.twitter.com/NIrTWDSnKk — Nayana Harish Pai #VoteForAarey (@harish_nayana) October 5, 2019

Many celebrities from Bollywood including Dia Mirza, Madhuri Dixit and Farhan Akhtar have voiced their opinions on the felling of trees in Aarey and there is protest scheduled in Mumbai on October 6 to actively protest the illegal move by MMRC.
